title: New: Father Sculptor – Aristide
content:
Glasgow’s Father Sculptor just get better with every track, moulding and refining their sound ensuring to caress every detail to their own preference.

Despite not having much of an online presence as of yet, they’re beginning to spread across the blogs, and it’s surely only a matter of time before they take their music to the UK live circuit. New track Aristide picks up where they left off with Frances, with their Smiths throwback sound and melancholic swagger. “Breathing slow and deep, inbetween the sheets in which you sleep” mourns lead singer Thomas David Hall, knowingly although with a tinge of adolescent uncertainty.
